title: Payment platform Lava raises $5.8M to build digital wallets for the ‘agent-native economy’
summary: Lava is a digital wallet that lets merchants use credits to facilitate transactions.

title: Amazon backs programmable optics startup Lumotive
summary: Lumotive reopened its February Series B round to add Amazon's Industrial Innovation Fund and ITHCA Group, increasing the size of the round to $59 million.

title: AI voice company Hyper raises $6.3M to help automate 911 calls
summary: Hyper hopes to use the fresh capital to help scale across the country, integrate more into existing 911 systems, hire a head of engineering, and build its next product.

title: The perfect pitch: This NEA partner says every founder should answer these 5 questions
summary: Tiffany Luck, a partner at NEA, outlined what she looks for in a pitch, during a presentation at TechCrunch’s All Stage event in Boston.

title: UK launches £500M package to support diverse, underrepresented investors and founders
summary: The British Business Bank, owned by the UK government, is creating a £500 million (around $674 million) economic package to help support diverse and underrepresented fund managers and founders in the country.

title: AI leadership development platform Praxis Labs sells to Torch
summary: Praxis Labs, a learning development platform, announced its acquisition on Thursday for an undisclosed amount by the leadership and coaching enterprise Torch.

title: Medium’s CEO explains what it took to stop losing $2.6M monthly
summary: Medium CEO Tony Stubblebine announced on Friday that the publishing platform has remained profitable since August of last year, when it first achieved this milestone.

title: How a data-processing problem at Lyft became the basis for Eventual
summary: Eventual's data processing engine Daft was inspried by the founders' experience working on Lyft's autonomous vehicle project.

title: Uptime Industries wants to boost localized AI usage with an ‘AI-in-a-box’ called Lemony AI
summary: The Lemony AI device can run large language models, AI agents and automated workflows locally.

title: Zeal Capital Partners announces close of $82M Fund II
summary: Zeal Capital Partners closed its second fund, raising $82 million. It hopes to invest in at least 25 early-stage companies, writing check sizes between $1 million and $2.3 million, with 50% of the fund reserved for follow-on investments.

title: Index Ventures’ Jahanvi Sardana shares the truth about TAM and what founders should focus on instead
summary: Index Ventures partner Jahanvi Sardana has a reminder for all those founders worried about finding TAM for their product or service: many startups have emerged from markets that, at the time, were essentially nonexistent.

title: How TRIC Robotics is reducing pesticide use on strawberries using UV light
summary: TRIC Robotics just raised a $5.5 million seed round for its tractor-sized robots that help eliminate bacteria and pests on strawberry plants.

title: Startups Weekly: Still running
summary: Welcome to Startups Weekly — your weekly recap of everything you can’t miss from the world of startups. Want it in your inbox every Friday? Sign up here. This newsletter took a break for the Fourth of July, and maybe you did, too, but the news didn’t. Even the biggest startups are still running after […]

title: Catalio Capital closes over $400M Fund IV
summary: Catalio Capital Management announced the closing of its more than $400 million Fund IV. The fund will continue the firm’s thesis of backing healthcare and biotechnology companies.

title: Startups Weekly: Tech and the law
summary: Here are the startup stories and funding rounds that caught our eye over the last few days, which have been quite busy.

title: Brad Feld on ‘Give First’ and the art of mentorship (at any age)
summary: Brad Feld has spent decades operating by a simple principle: Give without expecting anything in return.

title: Startups Weekly: Fast and furious
summary: Some startups accrued value at lightning speed this week, and we got confirmation that defense tech is red hot.

title: Startups Weekly: No sign of pause
summary: This week brought us many reminders that no startup journey is linear — but the next billion-dollar idea may only be one click away.

title: Startups Weekly: It’s buying season
summary: From acquiring stealth startups to larger ones, and from funding Series A to G, buyers and investors made for a busy news cycle.

title: Startups Weekly: Cutting through Google I/O noise
summary: Google I/O didn't stop startups from taking their chances and announcing some big deals this week.
gcjhv

title: Google Cloud’s data agents promise to end the 80% toil problem plaguing enterprise data teams
summary: New AI agents handle pipeline creation, data science workflows and analytics queries autonomously, potentially reshaping how enterprise data professionals spend their time.

title: Anthropic’s new Claude 4.1 dominates coding tests days before GPT-5 arrives
summary: Anthropic's Claude Opus 4.1 achieves 74.5% on coding benchmarks, leading the AI market, but faces risk as nearly half its $3.1B API revenue depends on just two customers.

title: OpenAI returns to open source roots with new models gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b
summary: Enterprises can use a powerful, near topline OpenAI LLM on their hardware totally privately and securely, without sending data to the cloud.

title: ChatGPT rockets to 700M weekly users ahead of GPT-5 launch with reasoning superpowers
summary: ChatGPT reaches 700 million weekly users as OpenAI prepares to launch GPT-5 with integrated reasoning capabilities in August 2025.

title: Qwen-Image is a powerful, open source new AI image generator with support for embedded text in English & Chinese
summary: My initial tests revealed the text and prompt adherence was not noticeably better than Midjourney, the popular proprietary AI image generator

title: Why tomorrow’s best devs won’t just code — they’ll curate, coordinate and command AI
summary: AI coding requires a serious structural change. Where does that leave entry-level developers and the software industry as a whole?

title: Why the AI era is forcing a redesign of the entire compute backbone
summary: Why fulfilling the promise of AI requires a step-change in capabilities far exceeding the advancements of the internet era.

title: New vision model from Cohere runs on two GPUs, beats top-tier VLMs on visual tasks
summary: Cohere's Command A Vision can read graphs and PDFs to make enterprise research richer and analyze the documents businesses actually rely on.

title: Why open-source AI became an American national priority
summary: To reflect democratic principles, AI must be built in the open. If the U.S. wants to lead the AI race, it must lead the open-source AI race.
